head.title: File:Flag of Croatia.svg - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
head.script: var skin="vector", stylepath="http://bits.wikimedia.org/skins-1.5", body.class: mediawiki ltr ns-6 ns-subject page-File_Flag_of_Croatia_svg skin-vector

div.p: Flag_of_Croatia.svg‎ (SVG file, nominally 1,200 × 600 pixels, file size: 57 KB)

This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons. Information from its description page there is shown below.
Commons is a freely licensed media file repository. You can help.

a.title: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

img.alt: This is a file from the Wikimedia Commons

div.p: Flag of Croatia from the Open Clip Art website (official 1:2 ratio).
Please use Image:Flag of Croatia icon.svg (of 2:3 ratio) for icons and smaller resolutions (better visibility in comparison to official 1:2 ratio).
Contributors from commons: Nightstallion, Elephantus, Neoneo13, Denelson83, Rainman, R-41, Minestrone, Lupo (listed in the order of real contribution to Image:Flag of Croatia.svg).

table.style: min-width:400px; text-align:left; color:#000; background:#ddd; border:1px solid #bbb; margin:1px; direction:ltr;

td.p: This vector image was created with Inkscape.

tr.th: (the) Flag of the Republic of Croatia*

tr.td:
flag includes the coat of arms
flag has 3 horizontal stripes
flag includes depiction of the animal/plant Martes martes
flag includes depiction of the animal/plant Panthera pardus
flag includes depiction of the animal/plant Capra aegagrus hircus
flag contains 2 stars (special formation of the stars: sixpointed stars).
Crescent is portrayed on this flag

a.title: th:ประเทศโครเอเชีย

div.a: ธงชาติโครเอเชีย

div.p: Same when printed and previewed (as much as possible).
Colours have been harmonized with Inkscape ver. 0.45.1, built: Mar 21 2007 (GNU - General Public License - programme).
They are based on a compromise reached on the Image talk:Flag of Croatia.svg.
The colours can be checked out at Image:Flag of Croatia icon.svg.

table.style: border:2px solid #d3d3d3; background-color:white; clear: both; margin: 0.5em auto; width:100%; text-align:center; cellpadding:0px; direction:ltr;

tr.td: It is easy to put a border around this image:

p.span: العربية | Беларуская (тарашкевіца) | Català | Česky | Dansk | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Esperanto | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Galego | Hrvatski | Magyar | Հայերեն | Bahasa Indonesia | Italiano | 日本語 | ქართული | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | Bahasa Melayu | Malti | Nederlands | ‪Norsk (bokmål)‬ | Polski | Português | Runa Simi | Română | Русский | Slovenčina | Српски / Srpski | Svenska | Türkçe | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | +/−

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction:ltr;

td.span: This image shows a flag, a coat of arms, a seal or some other official insignia. The use of such symbols is restricted in many countries. These restrictions are independent of the copyright status.

span.small: This tag does not indicate the copyright status or the source of the attached work. A normal copyright tag and a source are still required. See Commons:Licensing for more information.

p.span: Alemannisch | Boarisch | Български | Català | Česky | Dansk | Deutsch | Ελληνικά | English | Esperanto | Español | Eesti | Euskara | Suomi | Français | Hrvatski | Magyar | Bahasa Indonesia | Italiano | 日本語 | ქართული | 한국어 | Lietuvių | Македонски | മലയാളം | Plattdüütsch | Nederlands | Polski | Português | Română | Русский | ไทย | Українська | Vèneto | Tiếng Việt | 中文 | ‪中文(简体)‬ | ‪中文(繁體)‬ | 粵語 | +/−

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f7f8ff; border:2px solid #8888aa; direction: ltr;

tr.td:
This work is not an object of copyright according to the Copyright and related rights act of the Republic of Croatia.
Article 8.
The subject matter of copyright shall include expressions and not ideas, procedures, methods of operation or mathematical concepts as such.
The subject matter of copyright shall not include:
(1) discoveries, official texts in the domain of legislation, administration, judiciary (acts, regulations, decisions, reports, minutes, judgments, standards, and the like) and other official works and their collections, disclosed for the purpose of officially informing the public; (2) news of the day and other news, having the character of mere items of press information;
Folk literary and artistic creations in their original form shall not be the subject matter of copyright, but their communication to the public is subject to the payment of remuneration, as for the communication to the public of protected copyright works. The remuneration shall be the revenue of the budget, and shall be used for improving the creativity in the field concerned.
Note: Translations of official texts in the domain of legislation, administration and judiciary, shall be protected, unless made for the purpose of officially informing the public and are disclosed as such.
Full text of the Law: in Croatian, in English.

table.style: width:100%; clear:both; text-align:center; margin:0.5em auto; background-color:#f9f9f9; border:2px solid #e0e0e0; direction: ltr;

td.span: This file is from the Open Clip Art Library, which released it explicitly into the public domain, using the Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication.

span.small: To the uploader: Please provide as parameter the link to the page where this image appears.

p.span: Česky | Ελληνικά | English | Español | Français | Македонски | Polski | Português | Português do Brasil | Română | +/−

div.div:
Click on a date/time to view the file as it appeared at that time. (latest | earliest) View (newer 50 | older 50) (20 | 50 | 100 | 250 | 500)
Date/TimeThumbnailDimensionsUserComment
current18:42, 2 December 20091,200×600 (57 KB)Zscout370 (Cloned the shield pattern, the bars were at y 400.0012, changed it to exactly 400, etc.)
00:06, 30 April 20081,200×600 (60 KB)R-41 (Reverted to version as of 08:44, 29 April 2008 I can't believe what Rainman is saying, he is denouncing the Government of Croatia's webpage as being unreliable, it shows a template of the flag, with these colours!)
21:12, 29 April 20081,200×600 (60 KB)Rainman (Reverted to version as of 21:46, 27 April 2008 A compromise have been reached upon and your out-sourcing to a single instituton which is not in power to make such decisions is not correct. You have not discussed the change but went in direct confrontation)
08:44, 29 April 20081,200×600 (60 KB)R-41 (Corrected colours of flag based on those shown for flag on the Government of Croatia's webpage, http://www.vlada.hr/en/about_croatia/information/flag_coat_of_arms_and_national_anthem)
21:46, 27 April 20081,200×600 (60 KB)Rainman (Reverted to version as of 03:06, 20 February 2008 Completely harmonized colours which nobody objected at Image talk:Flag of Croatia.svg also it could have been seen during the presidential visit of Mr. Bush that Croatia blue is very different from USA)
03:21, 8 March 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Zscout370 (Updated shield)
23:54, 25 February 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Zscout370 (Colors pre editwar, fixed the arms slightly)
23:40, 25 February 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Zscout370 (Reverted to version as of 04:02, 6 February 2006 (before the edit wars began))
23:39, 22 February 20081,200×600 (60 KB)Rainman (Reverted to version as of 03:06, 20 February 2008 to Minestrone. The orriginal uploader gave OK. And the senior user Denelson83 gave me instructions on procedural issues. R-41 has not protested. We have citations from Vexilla Mundi and Presidential Decree)
18:45, 22 February 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 22:39, 20 February 2008)
23:21, 21 February 20081,200×600 (60 KB)Rainman (Reverted to version as of 03:06, 20 February 2008 Revertment without reasoning and without puting information on the discussion page is not an option. Minestrone is disruptive and probably a sockpupet of the user [[:User:Neoneo13|Neon)
22:39, 20 February 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 14:34, 19 January 2008)
03:06, 20 February 20081,200×600 (60 KB)Rainman (Completely harmonized colours which look the same when viewed on the screen and when printed. RGB and CMYK colour codes are harmonized with Inkscape. Description of the colours is on this very page.)
14:34, 19 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 20:53, 26 December 2007)
14:32, 19 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 22:34, 17 January 2008)
22:58, 17 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Rev 9 Dec '07 -- This is not right nor correct. Minestrone is a user that claims the colour blue be same as French Flag. This aproach is not documentary nor evidence.)
22:34, 17 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 17:03, 16 January 2008)
21:59, 16 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Stop this edit-war, accept fact, join discussion. I accept the rules and obey them, no matter you say otherwise. Don't preach about something you are not doing.)
17:03, 16 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 19:36, 14 January 2008. Rainman started everything. Be the first to accept the rules.)
23:58, 14 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Revt to prev. Discussion is not over. Only Lupo can move form the workspace. You do not discuss but react furiously. Revt to version before the workspace has been opened.)
19:36, 14 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 00:01, 2 January 2008. Cannot accept this version. Reverting revert.)
00:00, 14 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Revert to 9 Dec '07. Sync to all dependent img. Discussion not over. 2nd & 4th spike cannot be lighter that 3rd stripe, only Lupo can move files from workspace to this file, etc.)
00:01, 2 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 12:53, 31 December 2007. No need to comment this lunatic behavior.)
22:28, 1 January 20081,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Reverted to version as of 18:49, 27 December 2007 Minestrone is malicious.)
12:53, 31 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 22:21, 29 December 2007)
23:19, 29 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Croatia is not France and you should look for a word discussion in a dictionary, as well some other words like patience, respect of other discutants, list goes on and one)
22:21, 29 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 18:04, 28 December 2007)
21:50, 29 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Minestrone hadn't synchronized well, hadn't abided the rules for discussion as set by Lupo. Used 00209F instead of 0202B2 which Lupo proposed. Proclaimed the discussion's conclusion before the admin's oppinion, and so much more.)
18:04, 28 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 20:09, 27 December 2007. Rainman's justifications are void.)
00:24, 28 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (You haven't synchronized well, Civil Ensign yes, but Naval Ensign and Naval Jack and Croatian Coat of Arms - NO. Synchronizing to the majority of dependent images, as well protecting the still unresolved question of the colours, because administrators hav)
20:09, 27 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 20:53, 26 December 2007)
18:49, 27 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Synchronizing to the majority of dependent images, as well protecting the still unresolved question of the colours, because administrators have not closed the discussion nor proclaimed the version that should be moved from the workspace to the file Flag o)
20:53, 26 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Corrected the exact alignment of the coat and stripes. Compromise version until (color) dispute has been solved.)
20:24, 26 December 20071,200×600 (56 KB)Minestrone (Temporary version until the dispute has been solved. So far there have been no complaints about this version. Quite near to ultimate solution.)
23:14, 10 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Hope is eternal.)
23:49, 9 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman
02:22, 8 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman
20:09, 3 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (No one in their right mind cannot accept the usage of navy blue as the bottom band of the Flag, same as brown hoofs and horns of the goat, black marten (unheard in Croatia and Europe is the possibillity of black marten), different shades of red on the Fla)
10:48, 3 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Suradnik13 (Reverted to version as of 22:55, 28 November 2007)
00:29, 2 December 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Falsely transparent white (middle) band (stripe) corrected to proper ffffff.)
23:37, 29 November 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (Not turquoise, not brown hoofs nor horns on the goat, not black marten, not different colours of red all around the CoA, and not dark blue on the red-white-and-blue as the flag is called in Croatia)
22:55, 28 November 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 08:11, 30 September 2007)
22:55, 28 November 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 00:20, 28 November 2007)
22:54, 28 November 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Minestrone (Reverted to version as of 08:11, 30 September 2007. I would like to see the correct color code. Where's the law stating this color? Its deep blue.)
00:20, 28 November 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (True colours according to the Croatian law)
08:11, 30 September 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Denelson83 (Sorry; but several images are dependent on this image; synchronizing back to those images)
22:52, 25 September 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman (R-41 is shifting his/her position very frequently. The colors he/she presented are not according to the Croatian law of the questions of CoA, Flag, Anthem and other symbols. Firstly he/she seemed to be ready for the compromise, because the Croatian law is)
03:17, 23 September 20071,200×600 (57 KB)R-41 (Found correct colours, the tricolour is supposed to have a dark navy blue for the lower band, which it has now and from a Croatian government website I found out that in some of the "crown" sections there is supposed to be a light blue, rather than turquo)
23:41, 5 August 20071,200×600 (57 KB)R-41 (Incorrect colour in the first, third, and fifth "crown" sections from left to right corrected to turquoise based on a picture of the Croatian flag outside of the Croatian parliament at this link [http://www.croatianhistory.net/etf/coat4.html]. and also t)
22:01, 5 August 20071,200×600 (57 KB)Rainman ({{insigina}} Croatian flag has two blue colors, one of them - dark blue is not used for the blue stripe.)
(latest | earliest) View (newer 50 | older 50) (20 | 50 | 100 | 250 | 500)
